title: SmartLead Sheet Sync: Auto-Capture Client Inquiries to Airtable

readme:
âœ… What This Node Does:

It takes the cleaned submission data (from the Code node) and adds a new row to your Airtable base every time a lead submits your form.

â¸»

âš™ï¸ Airtable Setup Steps

  1. Create Your Airtable Base  
â€¢ Go to Airtable and create a new base (or use an existing one).  
â€¢ Create a table named something like Leads or Client Inquiries.  
â€¢ Add the following columns (fields) to your table:  
â€¢ Name  
â€¢ Email  
â€¢ Business Name  
â€¢ Project Intent/Need  
â€¢ Timeline  
â€¢ Budget



ğŸ” You can rename or customize these fields â€” just make sure the names match what you map in n8n.

â¸»

  1. Get Your Airtable API Credentials  
â€¢ In Airtable, click your account icon â†’ Developer Hub  
â€¢ Generate a Personal Access Token (with read/write permissions to the base youâ€™re using)



â¸»

  1. Configure the Airtable Node in n8n 
     1. Add an Airtable node after your Code node.
     2. Choose the operation: Create Record.
     3. Connect your Airtable account using the Personal Access Token.
     4. Select:  
â€¢ Base ID: Choose or paste your base  
â€¢ Table Name: Select your target table (e.g. Leads)
     5. Map fields like this:  
â€¢ Name â†’ {{$json["name"]}}  
â€¢ Email â†’ {{$json["email"]}}  
â€¢ Business Name â†’ {{$json["businessName"]}}  
â€¢ Project Intent/Need â†’ {{$json["project intent/need"]}}  
â€¢ Timeline â†’ {{$json["timeline"]}}  
â€¢ Budget â†’ {{$json["budget"]}}



â¸»

ğŸ”„ Test It  
1\. Submit your form with test data.  
2\. Check your Airtable table â€” a new row should appear instantly.
